channel.title: I don't get it. I can't connect to my server
channel.description:
I port forwarded to 43594 with TCP and I port forwarded it to my default gateway(192.168.1.1). I signed up on no-ip and I have it on and it's checked. I opened port 43594 on my firewall. My client is on my no-ip and uses port 43594. My server is running.
I tried it, and I get Error connecting to server but I did everything. It works fine with the IP 127.0.0.1, but I want my server the be public. Help??
EDIT: I fixed my CLASSPATH and rebooted but it still didn't work.
EDIT2: I tried it on Hamachi and it worked perfectly fine, so I'm guessing there's an error with my port forwarding.

item.title: I don't get it. I can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Patrickftw Patrickftw
item.description:
@Patrickftw wrote:

You need to portforward UDP too.

Read full topic

you cant connect to your server using your ip
other people should be able to connect still but you will have to log on using localhost

item.title: I don't get it. I can't connect to my server
item.dc:creator: @Rigged Rigged
item.description:
@Rigged wrote:

[quote=“Fraser11, post:4, topic:223454”]yes you would, rofl, all you need to connect to your server with 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0, or whatever, is just your server and click runserver…[quote author=Rigged link=topic=293507.msg2361925#msg2361925 date=1217648922]
Yes, because if I didn’t, I wouldn’t be able to even go on the server with the IP 127.0.0.1
[/quote][/quote]
Well then, I followed a guide and I did put in the enviroment tables and I have Java SE 10 I think.

Read full topic
